content.title: Post Harvest Marketing Scheme
content.details: The “Post Harvest Marketing Scheme” was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya for the creation of post harvest marketing infrastructure. Under the scheme, assistance is provided for evacuation facilities like pick-up trucks/ mini trucks/Tata mobile to the Farmers Groups/ Farmers Clubs/ SHG farmers Co-Operative Societies/ FIG/ FPOs, etc. for transportation of farm produce to the market.
benefits: Creation of infrastructural facilities for post harvest marketing

Evacuation facilities like pick-up trucks/ mini trucks/ Tata mobile to the Farmers Groups/ Farmers Clubs/ SHG farmers Co-Operative Societies/ FIG/ FPOs etc. for transportation of farm produce to the market: ₹2,00,000/- per Group or SHG. (50% Subsidy)
Village level Farmers training on Post Harvest Management: ₹189/day/farmer. (Daily allowance)
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Meghalaya.
The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in agriculture.
The applicant should possess owned or leased land of at least 0.2 hectares or more.
content.application_process: Offline. The eligible bonafide farmer can apply/write an application on plain paper and submit it at the nearest office of the Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Horticulture Circle.
documents_required: Documents proof of possessing own or leased land

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to create the post-harvest marketing infrastructure.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?
faqs.answer: Creation of infrastructural facilities for post harvest marketing, Grading Units etc.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers engaged in Agriculture, possessing own or leased land of at least 0.2 hectares or more are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper through the nearest Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Horticulture Circle.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers shall be selected on a first come first serve basis.
